result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam D Birkley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Adam D Birkley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Adam D Birkley was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Review hearing January 13, 2017 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 21.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Any cash bail on deposit to be applied.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

No contact with the victim unless requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or this Court. Third party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
No contact with firearms.
No new law violations.

Attend and successfully  complete Batterers Intervention.
Parenting classes.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam D Birkley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam D Birkley in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Request for payment of $68 witness fees for witness Teneisha F. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x25480406 in court 4x on 8/19/15, 1/27/16, 3/23/16, 8/31/16.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 10/21/16 for Teneisha F. for 4 appearances on 8/19/15, 1/27/16, 3/23/16, 8/31/16.

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 21.
Sentencing proceeded as to count 2.  Statements to the court by counsels and defendant.  Additional statement by Teneisha F.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 15 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 20 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1-13-2017 at 1:30pm in Branch 21.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention 
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Pay all child support.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The court was going to hear this case for sentencing, for Judge Davis, who is in trial.
After reviewing the file, the court talked to the parties at a sidebar and they decided to have it heard by Judge Davis.
Case calendared for another sentencing date in Branch 21.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court rescheduled 10/3/2016 sentencing to 10/10/2016 at 1:30. Parties notified.

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to negotiations and upon Motion of the State, Count 1 is dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 2:  

  Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

 
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 


Case adjourned to branch 21 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for Jury Trial.  

First call:  Parties ready to proceed. Case passed to address court calendar.  Second call: Court proceeding with another trial that attorney Valdez is on.  Parties request an adjourned Jury Trial date.    Court orders case adjourned.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to the Honorable Cynthia Davis, Branch 21 in Room 504 of the Courthouse.

  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for jury trial.  Both parties are prepared to proceed to jury trial.  No available spin court could be found.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 45.  Jury trial scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. State is readt to proceed with trial today. Case passed. Case recalled. Branch 38 is currently in trial and unable to try the case today, Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 45. All parties are notified that effective January 30, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackermann-Havas, Branch 45,  in Room 504 Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court has reviewed the memorandums submitted to the court.  The court indicates that the calls which have not been labeled as hearsay may be played as long as a proper foundation is provided.  Court orders case adjourned to 1-27-2016 in Branch 38 at 8:15a.m. for JURY TRIAL.  Parties do not require a FPT.  Jury trial scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Letter Brief filed by the state.
Letter Brief received and filed via email from Atty Valdez.

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was set for jury trial on today's date.  Several in chambers discussions were held and the case was passed to afternoon calendar.
Atty Valdez informs the court and counsel that he will be filing Sullivan and/or McMorris motions and is requesting a hearing date.  The court directs counsels to file all responses with supporting memorandums.  Defense to file by 9-18-2015 and the state to respond by 10-9-2015.  Hearing is set for 10-23-2015 at 8:15.
FILE RETAINED IN COURTROOM  Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status Conference held off the record.  Discovery and offer is needed by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 8-17-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Dluzak informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw is heard and granted by the Court.  Attorney Dluzak is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 6-22-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including the no contact order, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim, Teneisha F., appeared to request modification of the no contact order.  Court denied modification of the no contact order.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is requesting modification of the no contact order.  State advised that the victim was present earlier, and does not want modification of the no contact order.  Court maintains the current no contact order.  Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-9-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
Court ordered that the following names of children are added to the no contact order; Malik B. and Serenity F.   mld

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-7-2015 at 8:30 am.  

Victim, Teneisha F., appeared to request that the name of her child be added to the no contact order.  Court granted the request of victim, and ordered that the following children are added to the no contact order; Malik B. and Serenity F.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TENEISHA F.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Adam D Birkley in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Adam D Birkley in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
